dt: {bc}to bring over from one belief, view, or party to another

dt.t: They tried to {wi}convert{/wi} us to their way of thinking.
The missionaries {wi}converted{/wi} the native people to Christianity.

dt: {bc}to alter the physical or chemical nature or properties of especially in manufacturing
{bc}to change from one form or function to another
{bc}to make a goal after receiving (a pass) from a teammate
{bc}to score on (an attempt, such as a try for point or free throw)
{bc}to succeed in an attempt for a point, {d_link|field goal,|field goal} or {d_link|free throw|free throw}

pt: {sc}transform{/sc} {sc}metamorphose{/sc} {sc}transmute{/sc} {sc}convert{/sc} {sc}transmogrify{/sc} {sc}transfigure{/sc} mean to change a thing into a different thing. {sc}transform{/sc} implies a major change in form, nature, or function.

pt.t: {it}transformed{/it} a small company into a corporate giant

pt: {sc}metamorphose{/sc} suggests an abrupt or startling change induced by or as if by magic or a supernatural power.
{sc}transmute{/sc} implies transforming into a higher element or thing.
{sc}convert{/sc} implies a change fitting something for a new or different use or function.
{sc}transmogrify{/sc} suggests a strange or preposterous metamorphosis.

pt.t: a story in which a frog is {it}transmogrified{/it} into a prince

pt: {sc}transfigure{/sc} implies a change that exalts or glorifies.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}convertir{/it}, from Latin {it}convertere{/it} to turn around, transform, convert, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}vertere{/it} to turn {ma}{mat|worth|}{/ma}
shortdef: to bring over from one belief, view, or party to another
to bring about a religious conversion in
to alter the physical or chemical nature or properties of especially in manufacturing

dt: {bc}a proteolytic enzyme that converts the physiologically inactive form of angiotensin to the active vasoconstrictive form

shortdef: a proteolytic enzyme that converts the physiologically inactive form of angiotensin to the active vasoconstrictive form
